Description:
Gibbs, May.  Gold painted wooden frame, cream mount, glazed watercolour of a spray of leschenaultia with maiden hair fern. Signed LLC. Painted c1897.

Scanned image on CD  76

Huggins, JW (painter) & Duncan, E (engraver). Black and gilt painted elaborate wood frame, beige coloured mount, engraving, coloured aquatint. Rare print representing bivouac of Captain Stirling & exploration party in March 1827, 50 miles up Swan River. On back in ink "XG, FEVC from JGS August 1834". Comments on back of engraving: "From an original drawing in possession of F.R. Clause, Esqr. Surgeon, R.N. to whom this engraving is dedicated by his obedient servant J.W. Huggins."  Book references: Frances Edwards Catalogue & Partington Catalogue, No. 2246 p.148.  Painted c1830.
Information on inscription on back of painting located in Box 25, 1973/129â€¦   Also entered  Old Register No 1..

Oil painting of Sir John Forrest by artist Emmanuel Phillips Fox.   . Gold painted wood frame, unglazed oil.  Bust of Sir John Forrest in brown coat, dark shirt.  Dark background:  black & brown. Signed: LRC
HistoricalDetails: Artist b.1865 d.1915.    This has historical significance depicting the first Australian Baron and Premier of Western Australia JohnForrest.   Refer Dorothy Erickson's Audit 2014

Description: Gibbs, Herbert William. Pale grey &  gold painted wood frame unglazed oil scene South Fremantle. 3 yachts on R, 2 dinghies on L facing out to sea. Headlands R&L, white buildings on L. Back of painting: name of Gibbs, Herbert  in pencil (not believed to be artist's handwriting). Painted c1895.

Harper, Mary Alison. Gilt-painted wood frame, unglazed oil of Strawbwrry Hill Farmhouse, Albany, with grey roof. 3 sections: front: 1 storey: 2x6 paned windows, joining building with door & bell LHS, 2-storey 1x9 paned window & chimney. Post/rail fence. LHS stump; roof height, gateway,no gate. Signed LR.
Harper, Mary Alison. Unframed, unglazed oil painting of Gallop House overlooking Swan River. Signed: LRC.  Painted c1974.
Brown wood with gilt line frame, glazed, engraving/ etching of Perth Town Hall clock tower & people on Hay Street corner, painted c1916. Signed LL.
HistoricalDetails: Henri Van Raalte 1881-1929.   Refer notes D. Erickson's Audit 2014

Summary:
Rottnest settlement: Thomsons Bay 1900-1908. From right to left - The Pilot boats crew quarters-dining room, kitchen, etc. The opening in front was the boat shed. The Pilot took ships to Fremantle and he was later ferried back to the island. The second building was originally the Pilot's quarters, then the Signalmans and now Des Sullivan's house. The third building was semi-detached houses, the left one occupied by Chief Warder J.J. O'Donoghue on his retirement. In 1917 or 1918 O'Donoghue was transferred to the Board of Control. Another occupant was the school teacher. The fourth building was the Superintendents house. On the extreme left is the Governor's residence or Government House as the locals called it. The sea wall was built by Superintendent Vincent. 
Accession No. 43.120

Description:
Half-way Tree  in Claremont, Stirling Highway, south side opposite Vaucluse Street  

 Inscription reads "On this spot stood the Half-way Tree at which mailmen from Perth and Fremantle met and exchanged their mails from the earliest days of the colony up to 1867".
Place: Claremont, Stirling Highway, south side opposite Vaucluse Street

Description: William de Vlamingh : Inscription reads "William de Vlamingh Dutch Navigator who visited this island on the 30th December 1696 and named it Rottenest Island."  Located on Rottnest.

Description: Shoe, Infant's.  Only one shoette knitted in wool; Panel in front with raised knobs; ankle straps.
Materials: Wool, cotton, silk, bone (mother of pearl)

Description: Sugar bowl and cream jug of china, light brown with sprays of pink roses and leaves. Gold edges. Set into EPNS stand with handle. Provenance: Belonged to donor's aunt, Miss Annie George.
MakersMarks: No china mark. Mark under stand EPNS H & H 1587.
Dimensions: A. W:19.2cms; D:11.2cms; H:18cms. B. W:7.2cms; D:8.5cms; H:6cms. C:W:6cms; D:12cms; H:7.8cms

Description: Wooden box, japanned; opens to form a velvet covered writing surface. Bottom of box has divisions for storage. Box is black with ornamentation on lid of a circle of flowers of inlaid mother of pearl surrounding a bunch of flowers, painted and inlaid mother of pearl. Provenance: Belonged to Mrs Bridges, grand-daughter of Capt Thomas who came to WA on 'Gilmore' on 10/11/1829.
1 pair of nylon stockings. 15 denier micro mesh, seamless perfect nylons. Size 9 "GARDENIA"  in deep beige colour. New not worn.

The bedspread is knitted in a shell pattern with fine needles. The item must have been made by machine, as there are no joins in it and could not have been hand knitted. Provenance: A card sewn on to the bedspread states 'Bedspread knitted for Mrs S W Viveash 'Ashby' Middle Swan by her mother'. The Bicentennial Dictionary of Western Australians states that S.W. Viveash arrived in WA in 1838 per 'Britomart' with his wife and children. He married Susan Mary Smith, b 1813.
One single sheet with a 7.5cm wide row of hand-crocheted lace 5.5cms from top of sheet, crocheted in design of roses and leaves and hand sewn to sheet.

Triangular cribbage board with a brass knob at each join to act as a foot.  Each side has two holes to contain pegs, covered with a strip of brass fastened with a central pin, so cover can swivel to cover holes.  Stated by donor to be 100 years old.
Dimensions: L: 27.7 cm x  W: 27.7 cm x H: 27.7 cm

Description: Small, black fan, has black painted bamboo sticks with matt finish & guards with high gloss finish.  Leaf is of black satin with narrow band of silver on top edge.  Decoration is of red flowers with green and yellow leaves.

Description:
Cream silk net over gold sateen evening gown. Extensive panels of white and brown bugle beadwork to front bodice and centre front. V-shape neck with appliqued lace and bead insert. Elbow length sleeves with dropped glass beads and sequin trim. Net overlay is raised higher at front hem with bugle glass bead tassel. Ca 1911-1914. Heritage item

Collection Dreswses, Evening ca1910-1920

Lilac crepe, cocktail length evening dress.  Has V-shaped neck bound in cream silk & finished with a cream rosette.  Short sleeves trimmed with cream silk.  Basque waist trimmed in cream.  Bias cut skirt.  Zip to back (not original).
Made & worn by Mrs. Betty Sagar (nee Lankester) ca 1938-40 & subsequently worn again by her granddaughter in ca 1990.

ItemName: GREETING CARD WITH PAINTING OF CARNARVON DRY RIVER BED
Summary:
Greeting card with painting titled 'Dry River bed near Carnarvon, W.A.' signed P Berry
Printed in green inside card 'Dry river bed near Carnarvon, WA' By Paul Berry. /Paul, paralysed in the arms by poliomyelitis, paints with his foot.
With Best Wishes/for Christmas/and the New Year
Handwritten message in black ink
Creator: painting by Paul Berry for Paraplegic Association of WA
StatementOfSignificance: Representativeness: Greeting card with painting of Carnarvon done for Paraplegic Association of WA
Materials: paper, printing ink and writing ink

Summary:
Post card. Nurse Pearl Ashwin in nursing uniform  Meekatharra Hospital

Printed on reverse: Image: Nurse Pearl Ashwin, Meekatharra Hospital/State Library of Western Australia, BA368/278/My Story: Pearl Ashwin was one of the first Aboriginal women in Meekatharra to become a registered nurse and is pictured here working at Meekatharra Hospital.

Storylines is a State Library initiative to explore with the community the last 125 years of Aboriginal history through our heritage collections.
StatementOfSignificance: Interpretive: Photograph of Nurse Pearl Ashwin one of the first Aboriginal women in Meekatharra to become a registered nurse
